metadata.title: Story generated from search: "jesus, isa, mary"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And when she had given birth to the child, she said: "O Lord, I have delivered but a girl." -- But God knew better what she had delivered: A boy could not be as that girl was. "I have named her Mary," (she said), "and I give her into Your keeping. Preserve her and her children from Satan the ostracized."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when she gave birth to her she said, 'Lord, I have given birth to her, a female.' (And God knew very well what she had given birth to; the male is not as the female.) 'And I have named her Mary, and commend her to Thee with her seed, to protect them from the accursed Satan.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when she brought her forth, she said: my Lord verily have brought forth a female - and Allah knew best that which she had brought forth, - and the male is not as the female, and verily have named her Maryam, and verily seek refuge for her and her progeny with Thee from the Satan the accursed.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then when she delivered her [child Maryam (Mary)], she said: "O my Lord! I have delivered a female child," - and Allah knew better what she delivered, - "And the male is not like the female, and I have named her Maryam (Mary), and I seek refuge with You (Allah) for her and for her offspring from Shaitan (Satan), the outcast."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when she delivered her, she said, “My Lord, I have delivered a female,” and God was well aware of what she has delivered, “and the male is not like the female, and I have named her Mary, and have commended her and her descendants to Your protection, from Satan the outcast.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But when she gave birth to a female child, she said: 'O Lord! I have given birth to a female' - and Allah knew full well what she had given birth to - 'and a female is not the same as a male. I have named her Mary and commit her and her offspring to You for protection from Satan, the accursed.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then when she gave birth to her, she said: "O my Lord! I have given birth to a female child, ـ and Allah knew better what she bore, ـ "And the male is not like the female, and I have named her Maryam, and I seek refuge with You for her and for her offspring from Shaytan, the outcast."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when she was delivered she said: My Lord! Lo! I am delivered of a female - Allah knew best of what she was delivered - the male is not as the female; and lo! I have named her Mary, and lo! I crave Thy protection for her and for her offspring from Satan the outcast.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When she bore her, she said, ‘My Lord, I have borne a female [child]’—and Allah knew better what she had borne, and the male [child she expected] was no match for the female [child she had borne] —‘and I have named her Mary, and I commend her and her offspring to Your care against [the evil of] the outcast Satan.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when she was delivered of her, she said: 'Lord, I have given birth to her, a female' Allah knew of what she had given birth the male is not like the female 'and I have called her Mary. Protect her and all her descendants from satan, the stoned one'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But when she delivered her, she said, "My Lord, I have delivered a female." And Allah was most knowing of what she delivered, "And the male is not like the female. And I have named her Mary, and I seek refuge for her in You and [for] her descendants from Satan, the expelled [from the mercy of Allah]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the baby was born she said, "Lord, it is a female." God knew this. Male and female are not alike. "I have named her Mary. I pray that You will keep her and her offspring safe from Satan, the condemned one."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when she brought forth, she said: My Lord! Surely I have brought it forth a female-- and Allah knew best what she brought forth-- and the male is not like the female, and I have named it Marium, and I commend her and her offspring into Thy protection from the accursed Shaitan.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When she gave birth, she said, "My Lord, I have given birth to a girl," God knew very well what she had given birth to: a male is not like a female, "I have named her Mary and placed her and her children in Your protection from the rejected Satan."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When she was delivered, she said: "O my Lord! Behold! I am delivered of a female child!"- and Allah knew best what she brought forth- "And no wise is the male Like the female. I have named her Mary, and I commend her and her offspring to Thy protection from the Evil One, the Rejected."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Her Lord accepted her graciously, and she grew up with excellence, and was given into the care of Zachariah. Whenever Zachariah came to see her in the chamber, he found her provided with food, and he asked: "Where has this come from, O Mary?" And she said: "From God who gives food in abundance to whomsoever He will."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Her Lord received the child with gracious favour, and by His goodness she grew up comely, Zachariah taking charge of her. Whenever Zachariah went in to her in the Sanctuary, he found her provisioned. 'Mary,' he said, 'how comes this to thee?' 'From God,' she said. Truly God provisions whomsoever He will without reckoning.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then her Lord accepted her with goodly acceptance and made her grow up with a goodly growth, and He made Zakariyya take care of her. So oft as Zakariyya entered the apartment to see her, he found provision by her. He said: O Maryam! whence hast thou this! She said this is from before Allah. Verily Allah provideth for whomsoever He will without reckoning.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So her Lord (Allah) accepted her with goodly acceptance. He made her grow in a good manner and put her under the care of Zakariya (Zachariya). Every time he entered Al-Mihrab to (visit) her, he found her supplied with sustenance. He said: "O Maryam (Mary)! From where have you got this?" She said, "This is from Allah." Verily, Allah provides sustenance to whom He wills, without limit."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Her Lord accepted her with a gracious reception, and brought her a beautiful upbringing, and entrusted her to the care of Zechariah. Whenever Zechariah entered upon her in the sanctuary, he found her with provision. He said, “O Mary, where did you get this from?” She said, “It is from God; God provides to whom He wills without reckoning.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon her Lord graciously accepted Mary and vouchsafed to her a goodly growth and placed her in the care of Zechariah. Whenever Zechariah visited her in the sanctuary, he found her provided with food. He asked her: 'O Mary, how did this come to you?' She said: 'It is from Allah. Allah provides sustenance to whom He wills beyond all reckoning.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So her Lord (Allah) accepted her with goodly acceptance. He made her grow in a good manner and put her under the care of Zakariyya. Every time he entered the Mihrab to (visit) her, he found her supplied with sustenance. He said: "O Maryam! From where have you gotten this" She said, "This is from Allah." Verily, Allah provides sustenance to whom He wills, without limit.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And her Lord accepted her with full acceptance and vouchsafed to her a goodly growth; and made Zachariah her guardian. Whenever Zachariah went into the sanctuary where she was, he found that she had food. He said: O Mary! Whence cometh unto thee this (food)? She answered: It is from Allah. Allah giveth without stint to whom He will.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereupon her Lord accepted her with a gracious acceptance, and made her grow up in a worthy fashion, and He charged Zechariah with her care. Whenever Zechariah visited her in the sanctuary, he would find provisions with her. He said, ‘O Mary, from where does this come for you?’ She said, ‘It comes from Allah. Allah provides whomever He wishes without any reckoning.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Her Lord graciously accepted her. He made her grow with a fine upbringing and entrusted her to the care of Zachariah. Whenever Zachariah went to her in the sanctuary, he found that she had provision with her. 'Mary' he said, 'how does this come to you' 'It is from Allah' she answered. Truly, Allah provides whomsoever He will without reckoning.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So her Lord accepted her with good acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner and put her in the care of Zechariah. Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber, he found with her provision. He said, "O Mary, from where is this [coming] to you?" She said, "It is from Allah. Indeed, Allah provides for whom He wills without account."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Her Lord graciously accepted the offer and made Mary grow up, pure, and beautiful. Zachariah took custody of her. Whenever he went to visit her in her place of worship, he would find with her some food. He would ask her, "Where did this food come from?" She would reply, "God has sent it." God gives sustenance to whomever He wants without keeping an account.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So her Lord accepted her with a good acceptance and made her grow up a good growing, and gave her into the charge of Zakariya; whenever Zakariya entered the sanctuary to (see) her, he found with her food. He said: O Marium! whence comes this to you? She said: It is from Allah. Surely Allah gives to whom He pleases without measure.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Her Lord graciously accepted her and made her grow in goodness and entrusted her to the care of Zachariah. Every time Zachariah visited her in her chamber he found some provision with her. He asked, "Mary, where did this provision come from?" She replied, "This is from God. God provides for whoever He wills without measure."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Right graciously did her Lord accept her: He made her grow in purity and beauty: To the care of Zakariya was she assigned. Every time that he entered (Her) chamber to see her, He found her supplied with sustenance. He said: "O Mary! Whence (comes) this to you?" She said: "From Allah: for Allah Provides sustenance to whom He pleases without measure."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The angels said: "O Mary, indeed God has favoured you and made you immaculate, and chosen you from all the women of the world.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when the angels said, 'Mary, God has chosen thee, and purified thee; He has chosen thee above all women.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time the angels said: O Maryam! verily Allah chose thee and purified thee and chose thee above the women of the worlds.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when the angels said: "O Maryam (Mary)! Verily, Allah has chosen you, purified you (from polytheism and disbelief), and chosen you above the women of the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns) (of her lifetime)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The angels said, “O Mary, God has chosen you, and has purified you. He has chosen you over all the women of the world.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then came the time when the angels said: 'O Mary! Behold, Allah has chosen you, and made you pure, and exalted you above all the women in the world.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when the angels said: "O Maryam! Verily, Allah has chosen you, purified you, and chosen you above the women of the nations."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the angels said: O Mary! Lo! Allah hath chosen thee and made thee pure, and hath preferred thee above (all) the women of creation.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And when the angels said, ‘O Mary, Allah has chosen you and purified you, and He has chosen you above the world’s women.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when the angels said to Mary: 'Allah has chosen you and purified you. He has chosen you above all women of the worlds.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: "Behold," the angels told Mary, "God had chosen you, purified you, and given you distinction over all women.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when the angels said: O Marium! surely Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the world.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The angels said, "Mary, God has selected you and purified you. He has selected you over [all] the women of your time.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! the angels said: "O Mary! Allah hath chosen thee and purified thee- chosen thee above the women of all nations.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So adore your Lord, O Mary, and pay homage and bow with those who bow in prayer."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Mary; be obedient to thy Lord, prostrating and bowing before Him.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Maryam! be devout unto thy Lord, prostrate thyself, and bow down with them that bow down.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: O Mary! "Submit yourself with obedience to your Lord (Allah, by worshipping none but Him Alone) and prostrate yourself, and Irka'i (bow down etc.) along with Ar-Raki'un (those who bow down etc.)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “O Mary, be devoted to your Lord, and bow down, and kneel with those who kneel.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: O Mary! Remain devout to your Lord, and prostrate yourself in worship, and bow with those who bow (before Him).'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O Maryam! Submit yourself with obedience (Aqnuti) to your Lord and prostrate yourself, and bow down along with Ar-Raki`in."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O Mary! Be obedient to thy Lord, prostrate thyself and bow with those who bow (in worship).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: O Mary, be obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow down with those who bow [in worship].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Mary, be obedient to your Lord, prostrate and bow with those who bow'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O Mary, be devoutly obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in prayer]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Mary, pray devotedly to your Lord, prostrate yourself before Him and bow down with those who bow down before Him."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O Marium! keep to obedience to your Lord and humble yourself, and bow down with those who bow.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: O Mary! Remain truly devout to your Sustainer, and prostrate yourself in worship, and bow down with those who bow down [before Him]."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O Mary! worship Thy Lord devoutly: Prostrate thyself, and bow down (in prayer) with those who bow down."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: This is news of the Unknown that We send you, for you were not there when they cast lots with quills (to determine) who should take care of Mary, nor when they disputed it.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: (That is of the tidings of the Unseen, that We reveal to thee; for thou wast not with them, when they were casting quills which of them should have charge of Mary; thou wast not with them, when they were disputing.)

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: This is of the tidings of things hidden which We reveal unto thee and thou wast not with them when they cast their reeds as to which of them should take care of Maryam, nor wast thou with them when they disputed.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: This is a part of the news of the Ghaib (unseen, i.e. the news of the past nations of which you have no knowledge) which We inspire you with (O Muhammad SAW). You were not with them, when they cast lots with their pens as to which of them should be charged with the care of Maryam (Mary); nor were you with them when they disputed.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: These are accounts from the Unseen, which We reveal to you. You were not with them when they cast their lots as to which of them would take charge of Mary; nor were you with them as they quarreled.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad!) We reveal to you this account from a realm which lies beyond the reach of your perception for you were not with them when they drew lots with their pens about who should be Mary's guardian, and you were not with them when they disputed about it.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: This is a part of the news of the Ghayb (Unseen) which We reveal to you. You were not with them, when they cast lots with their pens as to which of them should be charged with the care of Maryam; nor were you with them when they disputed.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: This is of the tidings of things hidden. We reveal it unto thee (Muhammad). Thou wast not present with them when they threw their pens (to know) which of them should be the guardian of Mary, nor wast thou present with them when they quarrelled (thereupon).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: These accounts are from the Unseen, which We reveal to you, and you were not with them when they were casting lots [to see] which of them would take charge of Mary’s care, nor were you with them when they were contending.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: This is from the news of the unseen. We reveal it to you (Prophet Muhammad). You were not present when they cast their quills to see which of them should look after Mary, nor were you present when they were disputing.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary. Nor were you with them when they disputed.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), that was some of the news about the unseen, that We have revealed to you. You were not among those who cast lots by throwing their arrows to find out who would take custody of Mary, nor were you among those who disputed the matter.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: This is of the announcements relating to the unseen which We reveal to you; and you were not with them when they cast their pens (to decide) which of them should have Marium in his charge, and you were not with them when they contended one with another.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: This is an account of the unseen, which We reveal to you. You were not with them when they drew lots as to which of them should be Mary's guardian and you were not with them when they disputed with one another.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: This is part of the tidings of the things unseen, which We reveal unto thee (O Messenger!) by inspiration: Thou wast not with them when they cast lots with arrows, as to which of them should be charged with the care of Mary: Nor wast thou with them when they disputed (the point).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And of Mary, daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, so that We breathed into her a new life from Us, and she believed the words of her Lord and His Books, and was among the obedient.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Mary, Imran's daughter, who guarded her virginity, so We breathed into her of Our Spirit, and she confirmed the Words of her Lord and His Books, and became one of the obedient.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And the similitude of Maryram daughter of lmran, who preserved her chastity, wherefore We breathed in it Of Our Spirit. And she testified to the words of her Lord and His Books and she was of the devout.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Maryam (Mary), the daughter of 'Imran who guarded her chastity; and We breathed into (the sleeve of her shirt or her garment) through Our Ruh [i.e. Jibrael (Gabriel)], and she testified to the truth of the Words of her Lord [i.e. believed in the Words of Allah: "Be!" and he was; that is 'Iesa (Jesus) - son of Maryam (Mary); as a Messenger of Allah], and (also believed in) His Scriptures, and she was of the Qanitin (i.e. obedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her womb, and so We breathed into her of Our Spirit; and she believed in the truth of her Lord’s Words and His Books, and was one of the devout.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Allah has also set forth the parable of Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, and into whom We breathed of Our Spirit, and who testified to the words of her Lord and His Books. She was among the obedient.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Maryam, the daughter of `Imran who guarded her chastity (private part). And We breathed into it through Our Ruh, and she testified to the truth of her Lords Kalimat, and His Kutub, and she was of the Qanitin.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Mary, daughter of 'Imran, whose body was chaste, therefor We breathed therein something of Our Spirit. And she put faith in the words of her Lord and His scriptures, and was of the obedient.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Mary, daughter of Imran, who guarded the chastity of her womb, so We breathed into it of Our spirit. She confirmed the words of her Lord and His Books, and she was one of the obedient.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And, Mary, 'Imran's daughter, who guarded her chastity so We breathed into her of Our Spirit (Gabriel); and she put her trust in the Words of her Lord andHis Books, and was among the devout.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel, and she believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He has also told, as a parable, the story of Mary, daughter of Imran who preserved her virginity and (into whose womb) We breathed Our spirit. She made the words of her Lord and the predictions in His Books come true. She was an obedient woman.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Marium, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her of Our inspiration and she accepted the truth of the words of her Lord and His books, and she was of, the obedient ones.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [God gave another example in the story of] Mary, 'Imran's daughter, who preserved her chastity and We breathed Our spirit into her; she testified to the words of her Lord and His Scriptures, and was truly devout.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And Mary the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity; and We breathed into (her body) of Our spirit; and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and of His Revelations, and was one of the devout (servants).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Remember) her who preserved her chastity, into whom We breathed a new life from Us, and made her and her son a token for mankind.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And she who guarded her virginity, so We breathed into her of Our spirit and appointed her and her son to be a sign unto all beings.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And she who guarded her chastity! Then We breathed into her of Our spirit, and made her and her son a sign unto the worlds.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) she who guarded her chastity [Virgin Maryam (Mary)], We breathed into (the sleeves of) her (shirt or garment) [through Our Ruh - Jibrael (Gabriel)], and We made her and her son ['Iesa (Jesus)] a sign for Al-'Alamin (the mankind and jinns).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And she who guarded her virginity. We breathed into her of Our spirit, and made her and her son a sign to the world.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And also recall the woman who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her of Our spirit, and made her and her son a Sign to the whole world.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And she who guarded her chastity, We breathed into her through Our Ruh, and We made her and her son a sign for nations.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And she who was chaste, therefor We breathed into her (something) of Our Spirit and made her and her son a token for (all) peoples.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And [remember] her who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her Our spirit, and made her and her son a sign for all the nations.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And she (Mary) who guarded her virginity. We breathed into her of Our spirit (Gabriel), and made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Into the woman who maintained her chastity We breathed Our Spirit and made her and her son a miracle for all people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And she who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her of Our inspiration and made her and her son a sign for the nations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Remember the one who guarded her chastity; so We breathed Our Spirit into her, and made her and her son a sign for all people.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And (remember) her who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her of Our spirit, and We made her and her son a sign for all peoples.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and gave them shelter on an elevated ground, sequestered, watered by a spring.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and We made Mary's son, and his mother, to be a sign, and gave them refuge upon a height, where was a hollow and a spring:

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We made the son of Maryam and his mother a sign; and We sheltered the twain on a height: a quiet abode and running water.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We made the son of Maryam (Mary) and his mother as a sign, And We gave them refuge on high ground, a place of rest, security and flowing streams.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We made Mary’s son and his mother a sign, and We sheltered them on high ground with security and flowing springs.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We made Mary's son, and his mother, a Sign, and We gave them refuge on a lofty ground, a peaceful site with springs flowing in it.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We made the son of Maryam and his mother as a sign, and We gave them refuge on a Rabwah, Dhat Qarar, and Ma`in.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a portent, and We gave them refuge on a height, a place of flocks and watersprings.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and sheltered them in a level highland with flowing water.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and gave them a refuge on a hillside where there was a hollow and a spring.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We made the son of Mary and his mother a miracle and settled them on a high land, quite secure and watered by a spring.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We made the son of Marium and his mother a sign, and We gave them a shelter on a lofty ground having meadows and springs.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and gave them shelter on a peaceful hillside watered by a fresh spring.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We made the son of Mary and his mother as a Sign: We gave them both shelter on high ground, affording rest and security and furnished with springs.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then the angels said to him as he stood in the chamber at prayer: "God sends you good tidings of John who will confirm a thing from God and be noble, continent, and a prophet, and one of those who are upright and do good."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And the angels called to him, standing in the Sanctuary at worship, 'Lo, God gives thee good tidings of John, who shall confirm a Word of God, a chief, and chaste, a Prophet, righteous.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then the angels called unto him even while he stood Praying in the apartment: verily Allah announceth unto thee Yahya confessing to a word from Allah, and a leader, and a chaste and a prophet of the righteous one.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then the angels called him, while he was standing in prayer in Al-Mihrab (a praying place or a private room), (saying): "Allah gives you glad tidings of Yahya (John), confirming (believing in) the Word from Allah [i.e. the creation of 'Iesa (Jesus), the Word from Allah ("Be!" - and he was!)], noble, keeping away from sexual relations with women, a Prophet, from among the righteous."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then the angels called out to him, as he stood praying in the sanctuary: “God gives you good news of John; confirming a Word from God, and honorable, and moral, and a prophet; one of the upright.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: As he stood praying in the sanctuary, the angels called out to him: 'Allah gives you good tidings of John (Yahya), who shall confirm a command of Allah, shall be outstanding among men, utterly chaste, and a Prophet from among the righteous.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then the angels called him, while he was standing in prayer in the Mihrab, (saying): "Allah gives you glad tidings of Yahya, believing in the Word from Allah, and Sayyidan, and Hasuran, a Prophet, from among the righteous."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And the angels called to him as he stood praying in the sanctuary: Allah giveth thee glad tidings of (a son whose name is) John, (who cometh) to confirm a word from Allah lordly, chaste, a prophet of the righteous.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then, as he stood praying in the sanctuary the angels called out to him: ‘Allah gives you the good news of John, as a confirmer of a Word of Allah, eminent and chaste, a prophet, and one of the righteous.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And the angels called out to him when he was standing in the sanctuary worshipping, saying: 'Allah gives you glad tidings of John, who shall confirm a Word from Allah. He shall be a master and chaste, a Prophet and from the righteous'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, "Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of John, confirming a word from Allah and [who will be] honorable, abstaining [from women], and a prophet from among the righteous."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When he was standing during prayer in his place of worship, the angels called him saying, "God gives you the glad news of the birth of your son, John who will be a confirmation of (Jesus) the Word of God. He will become a chaste, noble leader and one of the righteous Prophets.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then the angels called to him as he stood praying in the sanctuary: That Allah gives you the good news of Yahya verifying a Word from Allah, and honorable and chaste and a prophet from among the good ones.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: As he stood praying in the chamber, the angels called out to him, saying, "God gives you the good news of John, who shall confirm the Word from God, and [shall be] outstanding among men, and utterly chaste, and a prophet from among the righteous."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: While he was standing in prayer in the chamber, the angels called unto him: "Allah doth give thee glad tidings of Yahya, witnessing the truth of a Word from Allah, and (be besides) noble, chaste, and a prophet,- of the (goodly) company of the righteous."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When the angels said: "O Mary, God gives you news of a thing from Him, for rejoicing, (news of one) whose name will be Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, illustrious in this world and the next, and one among the honoured,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When the angels said, 'Mary, God gives thee good tidings of a Word from Him whose name is Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary; high honoured shall he be in this world and the next, near stationed to God.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Recall what time the angels said: Maryam! verily Allah announceth unto thee a word from Him: his name Shall be the Masih, Isa, son of Maryam, illustrious in the world and the Hereafter and one of those brought nigh.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: (Remember) when the angels said: "O Maryam (Mary)! Verily, Allah gives you the glad tidings of a Word ["Be!" - and he was! i.e. 'Iesa (Jesus) the son of Maryam (Mary)] from Him, his name will be the Messiah 'Iesa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), held in honour in this world and in the Hereafter, and will be one of those who are near to Allah."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The Angels said, “O Mary, God gives you good news of a Word from Him. His name is the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, well-esteemed in this world and the next, and one of the nearest.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And when the angels said: 'O Mary! Allah gives you the glad tidings of a command from Him: his name shall be Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary. He shall be highly honoured in this world and in the Next, and shall be one of those near stationed to Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Remember) when the angels said: "O Maryam! Verily, Allah gives you the glad tidings of a Word from Him, his name will be Al-Masih, `Isa, the son of Maryam, held in honor in this world and in the Hereafter, and he will be one of those who are near to Allah."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (And remember) when the angels said: O Mary! Lo! Allah giveth thee glad tidings of a word from him, whose name is the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, illustrious in the world and the Hereafter, and one of those brought near (unto Allah).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When the angels said, ‘O Mary, Allah gives you the good news of a Word from Him whose name is Messiah, Jesus son of Mary, distinguished in the world and the Hereafter and one of those brought near [to Allah].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When the angels said: 'O Mary, Allah gives you glad tidings of a Word (Be) from Him, whose name is Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary. He shall be honored in this world and in the Everlasting Life and he shall be among those who are close.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [And mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to Allah].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: "Behold," the angels told Mary, "God has given you the glad news of the coming birth of a son whom He calls His Word, whose name will be Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, who will be a man of honor in this life and the life to come, and who will be one of the ones nearest to God.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When the angels said: O Marium, surely Allah gives you good news with a Word from Him (of one) whose name is the '. Messiah, Isa son of Marium, worthy of regard in this world and the hereafter and of those who are made near (to Allah).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When the angels said, "O Mary, your Lord gives you good news of a Word from Him. His name is the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, honoured in this world and in the next and one of those who are granted nearness to God.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! the angels said: "O Mary! Allah giveth thee glad tidings of a Word from Him: his name will be Christ Jesus, the son of Mary, held in honour in this world and the Hereafter and of (the company of) those nearest to Allah;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Who will speak to the people when in the cradle and when in the prime of life, and will be among the upright and doers of good."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “He will speak to people while he is in the cradle and in his adulthood, and will be of the devoted ones.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He shall speak to men in the cradle, and of age, and righteous he shall be.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And he shall speak unto mankind from the cradle and in maturity; and be one of the righteous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "He will speak to the people in the cradle and in manhood, and he will be one of the righteous."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He will speak to the people from the crib, and in adulthood, and will be one of the righteous.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And he shall speak to men in the cradle and also later when he grows to maturity and shall indeed be among the righteous.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "He will speak to the people, in the cradle and in manhood, and he will be one of the righteous."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He will speak unto mankind in his cradle and in his manhood, and he is of the righteous.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He will speak to the people in the cradle and in adulthood, and will be one of the righteous.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He shall speak to people in his cradle and when he is aged, and shall be among the righteous'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He will speak to the people in the cradle and in maturity and will be of the righteous."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He will speak to the people while in his cradle and preach to them when he will be a man. He will be one of the righteous ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And he shall speak to the people when in the cradle and when of old age, and (he shall be) one of the good ones.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Wayukallimu alnnasa fee almahdi wakahlan wamina alssaliheena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And he shall speak to men in his cradle, and as a grown man, and shall be one of the righteous."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "He shall speak to the people in childhood and in maturity. And he shall be (of the company) of the righteous."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: She said: "How can I have a son, O Lord, when no man has touched me?" He said: "That is how God creates what He wills. When He decrees a thing, He says 'Be', and it is.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'Lord,' said Mary, 'how shall I have a son seeing no mortal has touched me?' 'Even so,' God said, God creates what He will. When He decrees a thing He does but say to it "Be," and it is.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: She said: my Lord! in what wise shall there be unto me a son whereas no human being hath touched me. Allah said: even so. Allah createth whatsoever He will, When He hath decreed a thing, He only saith to it: Be, and it becometh;

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: She said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son when no man has touched me." He said: "So (it will be) for Allah creates what He wills. When He has decreed something, He says to it only: "Be!" and it is.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: She said, “My Lord, how can I have a child, when no man has touched me?” He said, “It will be so. God creates whatever He wills. To have anything done, He only says to it, ‘Be,’ and it is.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: She said: 'O my Lord! How shall I have a son when no man has ever touched me?' The angel answered: Thus shall it be. Allah creates whatever He wills. When He decides something, He merely says: "Be" and it is.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: She said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son when no man has touched me." He said: "So (it will be) for Allah creates what He wills. When He has decreed something, He says to it only: `Be! ـ and it is."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: She said: My Lord! How can I have a child when no mortal hath touched me? He said: So (it will be). Allah createth what He will. If He decreeth a thing, He saith unto it only: Be! and it is.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: She said, ‘My Lord, how shall I have a child seeing that no human has ever touched me?’ He said, ‘So it is that Allah creates whatever He wishes. When He decides on a matter He just says to it ‘‘Be!’’ and it is.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Lord' she said, 'how can I bear a child when no human being has touched me' He replied: 'Such is the Will of Allah. He creates whom He will. When He decrees a thing, He only says: "Be," and it is.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: She said, "My Lord, how will I have a child when no man has touched me?" [The angel] said, "Such is Allah; He creates what He wills. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Mary) said, "How can there be a son for me when no mortal has touched me?" The angel replied, "That is how God creates whatever He wants. When He decides to do something He just orders it to exist and it comes into existence."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: She said: My Lord! when shall there be a son (born) to I me, and man has not touched me? He said: Even so, Allah creates what He pleases; when He has decreed a matter, He only says to it, Be, and it is.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "Lord," she said, "how can I have a child when no man has touched me?" [The angel] replied, "Thus it is: God creates what He wills: when He wills a thing He need only say, "Be," and it is.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: She said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son when no man hath touched me?" He said: "Even so: Allah createth what He willeth: When He hath decreed a plan, He but saith to it, 'Be,' and it is!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He will teach him the Law and the judgement, and the Torah and the Gospel,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And He will teach him the Book, the Wisdom, the Torah, the Gospel,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And He shall teach him the Book and wisdom and the Taurat and the Injil:

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And He (Allah) will teach him ['Iesa (Jesus)] the Book and Al-Hikmah (i.e. the Sunnah, the faultless speech of the Prophets, wisdom, etc.), (and) the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And He will teach him the Scripture and wisdom, and the Torah and the Gospel.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And He will teach him the Book, the Wisdom, the Torah, the Gospel,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And He will teach him the Book and Al-Hikmah, and the Tawrah and the Injil.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And He will teach him the Scripture and wisdom, and the Torah and the Gospel,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He will teach him the Book and wisdom, the Torah and the Evangel,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He will teach him the Book, the Wisdom, the Torah and the Gospel,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And He will teach him writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: God will give (Jesus) wisdom and teach him the Book, the Torah, and the Gospel.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And He will teach him the Book and the wisdom and the Tavrat and the Injeel.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God will instruct him in the Book and in wisdom and in the Torah and in the Gospel.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And Allah will teach him the Book and Wisdom, the Law and the Gospel,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Commemorate Mary in the Book. When she withdrew from her family to a place in the East

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And mention in the Book Mary when she withdrew from her people to an eastern place,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And mention thou in the Book Maryam, what time the retired from her people to a place eastward.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And mention in the Book (the Quran, O Muhammad SAW, the story of) Maryam (Mary), when she withdrew in seclusion from her family to a place facing east.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And mention in the Scripture Mary, when she withdrew from her people to an eastern location.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Mary, when she withdrew from her people to a place towards the east;

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Maryam, when she withdrew in seclusion from her family to place facing east.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And make mention of Mary in the Scripture, when she had withdrawn from her people to a chamber looking East,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And mention in the Book Mary, when she withdrew from her family to an easterly place.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Mary, how she withdrew from her people to an eastern place and she took a veil apart from them;

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), mention in the Book (the Quran) the story of Mary how she left her family and started living in a solitary place to the East

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And mention Marium in the Book when she drew aside from her family to an eastern place;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Recount in the Book how Mary withdrew from her people to an eastern place

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And took cover from them, We sent a spirit of Ours to her who appeared before her in the concrete form of a man.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So there she screened herself from them; We therefore sent Our Spirit towards her – he appeared before her in the form of a healthy man. (Angel Jibreel – peace be upon him.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and she took a veil apart from them; then We sent unto her Our Spirit that presented himself to her a man without fault.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then she took beside them a curtain; then We sent unto her Our Spirit, and he took unto her the form of a human being sound.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent to her Our Ruh [angel Jibrael (Gabriel)], and he appeared before her in the form of a man in all respects.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: She screened herself away from them, and We sent to her Our spirit, and He appeared to her as an immaculate human.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and drew a curtain, screening herself from people whereupon We sent to her Our spirit and he appeared to her as a well-shaped man.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: She placed a screen before them; then We sent to her Our Ruh, and he appeared before her in the form of a man in all respects.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And had chosen seclusion from them. Then We sent unto her Our Spirit and it assumed for her the likeness of a perfect man.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thus did she seclude herself from them, whereupon We sent to her Our Spirit and he became incarnate for her as a well-proportioned human.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent to her Our Spirit (Gabriel) in the resemblance of a perfect human.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: out of her people's sight. We sent Our Spirit to her, who stood before her in the shape of a well formed human being.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So she took a veil (to screen herself) from them; then We sent to her Our spirit, and there appeared to her a well-made man.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Faittakhathat min doonihim hijaban faarsalna ilayha roohana fatamaththala laha basharan sawiyyan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and kept herself in seclusion from them. We sent her Our angel, who presented himself to her as a full-grown human being.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent her our angel, and he appeared before her as a man in all respects.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "I seek refuge in the Merciful from you, if you fear Him," she said.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: She said, 'I take refuge in the All-merciful from thee!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: She said: verily seek refuge with the Compassionate from thee if thou art God-fearing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: She said: "Verily! I seek refuge with the Most Beneficent (Allah) from you, if you do fear Allah."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: She said, “I take refuge from you in the Most Merciful, should you be righteous.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Mary exclaimed: "I surely take refuge from you with the Most Compassionate Lord, if you are at all God-fearing."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: She said: "Verily, I seek refuge with the Most Gracious (Allah) from you, if you do fear Allah."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: She said: Lo! I seek refuge in the Beneficent One from thee, if thou art Allah-fearing.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: She said, ‘I seek the protection of the All-beneficent from you, should you be Godwary!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (And when she saw him) she said: 'I take refuge in the Merciful from you! If you are fearful'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Mary said, "Would that the Beneficent God would protect me from you. Leave me alone if you are a God fearing person".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: She said: Surely I fly for refuge from you to the Beneficent Allah, if you are one guarding (against evil).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When she saw him, she said, "I seek refuge in the compassionate God from you; [do not come near] if you fear the Lord."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: She said: "I seek refuge from thee to (Allah) Most Gracious: (come not near) if thou dost fear Allah."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He replied: "I am only a messenger from your Lord (sent) to bestow a good son on you."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He said, “I am indeed one sent by your Lord; so that I may give you a chaste son.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: If thou fearest God... He said, 'I am but a messenger come from thy Lord, to give thee a boy most pure.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: I am but a meenger from thy Lord that I may bestow on thee a boy pure.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: (The angel) said: "I am only a Messenger from your Lord, (to announce) to you the gift of a righteous son."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “I am only the messenger of your Lord, to give you the gift of a pure son.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "I am just a message-bearer of your Lord, I have come to grant you a most pure boy."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (The angel) said: "I am only a messenger from your Lord, (to announce) to you the gift of a righteous son."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: I am only a messenger of thy Lord, that I may bestow on thee a faultless son.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘I am only a messenger of your Lord that I may give you a pure son.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'I am the Messenger of your Lord' he replied, 'and have come to give you a pure boy'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "I am the Messengers of your Lord. I have come to give you a purified son".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: I am only a messenger of your Lord: That I will give you a pure boy.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qala innama ana rasoolu rabbiki liahaba laki ghulaman zakiyyan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "I am only the messenger of your Lord," he replied. "I shall bestow upon you the gift of a son endowed with purity."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Nay, I am only a messenger from thy Lord, (to announce) to thee the gift of a holy son.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "How can I have a son," she said, "when no man has touched me, nor am I sinful?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: She said, 'How shall I have a son whom no mortal has touched, neither have I been unchaste?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: She said: in what wise shall there be a boy unto me, whereas not a human being hath touched me, nor have I been a harlot?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: She said: "How can I have a son, when no man has touched me, nor am I unchaste?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: She said, “How can I have a son, when no man has touched me, and I was never unchaste?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Mary said: "How can a boy be born to me when no man has even touched me, nor have I ever been unchaste?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: She said: "How can I have a son when no man has touched me, nor am I Baghiyya"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: She said: How can I have a son when no mortal hath touched me, neither have I been unchaste?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: She said, ‘How shall I have a child seeing that no human being has ever touched me, nor have I been unchaste?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'How shall I bear a son' she answered, 'when I am not touched by a human and not unchaste'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: She said, "How can I have a son when no mortal has touched me nor am I an unchaste woman".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: She said: When shall I have a boy and no mortal has yet touched me, nor have I been unchaste?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: She said, "How can I have a son when no man has touched me; and neither have I been unchaste?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: She said: "How shall I have a son, seeing that no man has touched me, and I am not unchaste?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then (a voice) called to her from below: "Grieve not; your Lord has made a rivulet gush forth right below you.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: But the one that was below her called to her, 'Nay, do not sorrow; see, thy Lord has set below thee a rivulet.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then one cried unto her from underneath her, that grieve not, thy Lord hath placed underneath thou a rivulet.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then [the babe 'Iesa (Jesus) or Jibrael (Gabriel)] cried unto her from below her, saying: "Grieve not! Your Lord has provided a water stream under you;

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Whereupon he called her from beneath her: “Do not worry; your Lord has placed a stream beneath you.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon the angel below her cried out: "Grieve not, for your Lord has caused a stream of water to flow beneath you.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then he cried unto her from below her, saying: "Grieve not: your Lord has provided a Sariy under you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then (one) cried unto her from below her, saying: Grieve not! Thy Lord hath placed a rivulet beneath thee,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereupon he called her from below her [saying,] ‘Do not grieve! Your Lord has made a spring to flow at your feet.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He called from below to her: 'Do not sorrow, look, your Lord has provided a rivulet below you,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Then she heard the baby saying, "Do not be sad. Your Lord has caused a stream to run at your feet.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then (the child) called out to her from beneath her: Grieve not, surely your Lord has made a stream to flow beneath you;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But a voice called out to her from below, "Do not despair. Your Lord has provided a brook that runs at your feet,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But (a voice) cried to her from beneath the (palm-tree): "Grieve not! for thy Lord hath provided a rivulet beneath thee;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Shake the trunk of the date-palm tree, and it will drop ripe dates for you.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you – ripe fresh dates will fall upon you.” (This was a miracle – the date palm was dry and it was winter season.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Shake also to thee the palm-trunk, and there shall come tumbling upon thee dates fresh and ripe.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And shake toward thee the trunk of the palm-tree it shall drop on thee dates fresh and ripe.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And shake the trunk of date-palm towards you, it will let fall fresh ripe-dates upon you."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you, and it will drop ripe dates by you.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards yourself and fresh and ripe dates shall fall upon you.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And shake the trunk of date palm towards you, it will let fall fresh ripe dates upon you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree toward thee, thou wilt cause ripe dates to fall upon thee.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Shake the trunk of the palm tree, freshly picked dates will drop upon you.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and shake the trunk of this palmtree it will drop fresh ripe dates upon you.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: If you shake the trunk of the palm tree, it will provide you with fresh ripe dates.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And shake towards you the trunk of the palmtree, it will drop on you fresh ripe dates:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Wahuzzee ilayki bijithAAi alnnakhlati tusaqit AAalayki rutaban janiyyan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and if you shake the trunk of this palm-tree, it will drop fresh ripe dates on you.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: It will let fall fresh ripe dates upon thee.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Eat and drink, and be at peace. If you see any man, tell him: 'I have verily vowed a fast to Ar-Rahman and cannot speak to any one this day.'

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Therefore eat and drink and appease your eyes; so if you meet any person then say, ‘I have pledged a fast (of silence) to the Most Gracious – I will therefore not speak to any person today.’”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Eat therefore, and drink, and be comforted; and if thou shouldst see any mortal, say, "I have vowed to the All-merciful a fast, and today I will not speak to any man.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: So eat and drink thou, and cool thine eyes; and if thou beholdest the human beings anyone, say: verily I have vowed to the Compassionate a fast, so I shall not speak today to any human being.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "So eat and drink and be glad, and if you see any human being, say: 'Verily! I have vowed a fast unto the Most Beneficent (Allah) so I shall not speak to any human being this day. 

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “So eat, and drink, and be consoled. And if you see any human, say, ‘I have vowed a fast to the Most Gracious, so I will not speak to any human today.'“

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: So eat and drink and cool your eyes; and if you see any person say to him: 'Verily I have vowed a fast to the Most Compassionate Lord, and so I shall not speak to anyone today.' "

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "So eat and drink and rejoice. And if you see any human being, say: `Verily, I have vowed a fast for the Most Gracious so I shall not speak to any human being today.,"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: So eat and drink and be consoled. And if thou meetest any mortal, say: Lo! I have vowed a fast unto the Beneficent, and may not speak this day to any mortal.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Eat, drink, and be comforted. Then if you see any human, say, ‘‘Indeed I have vowed a fast to the All-beneficent, so I will not speak to any human today.’’ ’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Therefore eat and drink and rejoice with your eyes. If you meet any human say to him: "I have vowed a fast to the Merciful and will not speak with anyone today.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' "

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Eat, drink, and rejoice. Should you see a person going by, tell him that on this day you have promised the Beneficent God to fast and never talk to any human being."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So eat and drink and refresh the eye. Then if you see any mortal, say: Surely I have vowed a fast to the Beneficent Allah, so I shall not speak to any man today.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Fakulee waishrabee waqarree AAaynan faimma tarayinna mina albashari ahadan faqoolee innee nathartu lilrrahmani sawman falan okallima alyawma insiyyan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Eat and drink and rejoice. And if you see any human being say, 'I have vowed a fast [of silence] to the Gracious God, and will not speak with any human being today.'"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "So eat and drink and cool (thine) eye. And if thou dost see any man, say, 'I have vowed a fast to (Allah) Most Gracious, and this day will I enter into not talk with any human being'"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then she brought the child to her people. They exclaimed: "O Mary, you have done a most astonishing thing!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then she brought the child to her folk carrying him; and they said, 'Mary, thou hast surely committed a monstrous thing!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then she brought him to her nation carrying him. They said: Maryam! assuredly thou hast brought a thing unheard Of.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then she brought him (the baby) to her people, carrying him. They said: "O Mary! Indeed you have brought a thing Fariya (an unheard mighty thing).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then she came to her people, carrying him. They said, “O Mary, you have done something terrible.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then she came to her people, carrying her baby. They said: "O Mary! You have committed a monstrous thing.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said: "O Mary! Indeed you have brought a thing Fariy."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then she brought him to her own folk, carrying him. They said: O Mary! Thou hast come with an amazing thing.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then carrying him she brought him to her people. They said, ‘O Mary, you have certainly come up with an odd thing!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: She came to her nation, carrying him; and they said: 'O Mary, you have committed a monstrous thing.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: She took him to her people and they said, "Mary, this is indeed an strange thing.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And she came to her people with him, carrying him (with her). They said: O Marium! surely you have done a strange thing.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Carrying her child, she brought him to her people. They said, "O Mary, you have indeed done something terrible!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: At length she brought the (babe) to her people, carrying him (in her arms). They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou brought!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a wicked person, nor your mother sinful!"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Sister of Aaron, thy father was not a wicked man, nor was thy mother a woman unchaste.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O sister of Harun: thy father was not a man of evil, nor was thy mother a harlot.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O sister (i.e. the like) of Harun (Aaron) [not the brother of Musa (Moses), but he was another pious man at the time of Maryam (Mary)]! Your father was not a man who used to commit adultery, nor your mother was an unchaste woman."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O sister of Aaron, your father was not an evil man, and your mother was not a whore.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: O sister of Aaron! Your father was not an evil man, nor was your mother an unchaste woman."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O sister of Harun! Your father was not a man who used to commit adultery, nor your mother was an unchaste woman."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a wicked man nor was thy mother a harlot.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: O sister of Aaron[’s lineage]! Your father was not an evil man, nor was your mother unchaste.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: O sister of Aaron, your father was never an evil man, nor was your mother unchaste'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Aaron's sister, your father was not a bad man nor was your mother unchaste".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O sister of Haroun! your father was not a bad man, nor, was your mother an unchaste woman.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Sister of Aaron, your father was not an evil man, nor was your mother an unchaste woman!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a man of evil, nor thy mother a woman unchaste!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But she pointed towards him. "How can we talk to one," they said, "who is only an infant in the cradle?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Mary pointed to the child then; but they said, 'How shall we speak to one who is still in the cradle, a little child?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then she Pointed to him. They said: how shall we speak to one who is in the cradle, a child?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then she pointed to him. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So she pointed to him. They said, “How can we speak to an infant in the crib?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon Mary pointed to the child. They exclaimed: "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle, a mere child?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then she pointed to him. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then she pointed to him. They said: How can we talk to one who is in the cradle, a young boy?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereat she pointed to him. They said, ‘How can we speak to one who is yet a baby in the cradle?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So she pointed to him (Prophet Jesus). But they replied: 'How can we speak with a baby in the cradle'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: She pointed to the baby (and referred them to him for their answer). They said, "How can we talk to a baby in the cradle?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But she pointed to him. They said: How should we speak to one who was a child in the cradle?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: She pointed to the child. They said, "How shall we talk to someone who is a child in the cradle?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But she pointed to the babe. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "I am a servant of God," he answered. "He has given me a Book and made me a prophet,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Lo, I am God's servant; God has given me the Book, and made me a Prophet.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He Said: verily I am a bondman of Allah; He hath vouchsafed me the Book and made me a prophet.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "He ['Iesa (Jesus)] said: Verily! I am a slave of Allah, He has given me the Scripture and made me a Prophet;"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “I am the servant of God. He has given me the Scripture, and made me a prophet.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The child cried out: "Verily I am Allah's servant. He has granted me the Book and has made me a Prophet

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Verily, I am a servant of Allah, He has given me the Scripture and made me a Prophet;"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He spake: Lo! I am the slave of Allah. He hath given me the Scripture and hath appointed me a Prophet,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Indeed I am a servant of Allah! He has given me the Book and made me a prophet.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (the baby) said: 'I am the worshiper of Allah. Allah has given me the Book and made me a Prophet.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "I am the servant of God. He has given me the Book and has appointed me to be a Prophet.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Surely I am a servant of Allah; He has given me the Book and made me a prophet;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [But] he said, "I am God's servant. He has given me the Book and made me a prophet;

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "I am indeed a servant of Allah: He hath given me revelation and made me a prophet;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: This was Jesus, son of Mary: A true account they contend about.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: This is Eisa (Jesus), the son of Maryam; a true statement, in which they doubt.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: That is Jesus, son of Mary, in word of truth, concerning which they are doubting.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Such is 'lsa, son of Maryam: this Is the word of truth wherein they are doubting.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Such is 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary). (it is) a statement of truth, about which they doubt (or dispute).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: That is Jesus son of Mary—the Word of truth about which they doubt.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: This is Jesus, the son of Mary; and this is the truth about him concerning which they are in doubt.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Such is `Isa, son of Maryam. Qawlal-Haqq [it is a statement of truth] about which they doubt (or dispute).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Such was Jesus, son of Mary: (this is) a statement of the truth concerning which they doubt.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: That is Jesus, son of Mary, a Word of the Real concerning whom they are in doubt.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Such was (Prophet) Jesus, the son of Mary. A saying of truth, concerning what they doubt.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Such was the true story of Jesus, the son of Mary, about which they dispute bitterly.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Such is Isa, son of Marium; (this is) the saying of truth about which they dispute.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Such was Jesus, the son of Mary. That is the whole truth, about which they still dispute:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Such (was) Jesus the son of Mary: (it is) a statement of truth, about which they (vainly) dispute.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: It does not behove God to have a son. Too immaculate is He! When He decrees a thing He has only to say: "Be", and it is.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: It is not for God to take a son unto Him. Glory be to Him! When He decrees a thing, He but says to it 'Be,' and it is.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Allah is not one to take to Himself a son. Hallowed be He! whensoever He decreeth an affair he only Saith to it: be, and it becometh.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: It befits not (the Majesty of) Allah that He should beget a son [this refers to the slander of Christians against Allah, by saying that 'Iesa (Jesus) is the son of Allah]. Glorified (and Exalted be He above all that they associate with Him). When He decrees a thing, He only says to it, "Be!" and it is.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: It is not for God to have a child—glory be to Him. To have anything done, He says to it, “Be,” and it becomes.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: It does not befit Allah to take for Himself a son. Glory be to Him! When He decrees a thing He only says: "Be" and it is.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
